lemma: Seventy times seven
context1: Christ tells us to infinitely forgive those who wrong us. Seventy times seven is an expression representing an infinite sum.
context2: Jesus answered: I do not tell you up to seven, but even up to seventy times seven. The number seven or 70X7 was not to set a limit on the number of times to forgive, but precisely the opposite. Christ meant that forgiveness should be granted unendingly, innumerable times.
